game.s_dis: Dr. Mario + Puzzle League for GBA combines two of Nintendo’s most iconic puzzle games — match colors to clear viruses in Dr. Mario or line up falling blocks in Puzzle League for endless brain-teasing fun.
game.l_dis:
Play Dr. Mario + Puzzle League GBA Online – Classic Puzzle Combo

Dr. Mario + Puzzle League is a Game Boy Advance compilation featuring two timeless puzzle hits from Nintendo. Players can switch between Dr. Mario, the virus-busting classic, and Puzzle League, a fast-paced color-matching challenge originally known as Panel de Pon or Tetris Attack.

About Dr. Mario + Puzzle League

Released in 2005, this collection brings together two highly addictive games on one cartridge. Dr. Mario challenges players to eliminate viruses using color-matching capsules, while Puzzle League tasks you with aligning falling blocks to clear them and score combos. Each game includes multiple difficulty settings, modes, and two-player functionality via link cable.

Gameplay Features

  • Two Classic Games in One: Enjoy both Dr. Mario and Puzzle League on a single cartridge.
  • Dr. Mario Mode: Match colored pills to destroy viruses before the bottle fills up.
  • Puzzle League Mode: Swap colored tiles to form matches of three or more and rack up combos.
  • Multiple Game Modes: Includes Classic, Flash, and Endless modes for different challenges.
  • Multiplayer Fun: Link up with a friend for competitive puzzle battles.

How to Play Online

You can play Dr. Mario + Puzzle League for free online in your browser. No emulator or download is needed—just load and play instantly. Compete against the clock, aim for high scores, or test your puzzle skills anywhere.

Why Play Dr. Mario + Puzzle League?

  • Perfect Puzzle Variety: Two distinct puzzle styles in one game.
  • Fast-Paced Gameplay: Easy to learn, hard to master mechanics keep it engaging.
  • Great for All Ages: Simple controls and vibrant visuals make it family-friendly.

Summary

Dr. Mario + Puzzle League delivers double the puzzle action on the Game Boy Advance. Whether you prefer strategic virus-clearing or rapid tile-matching, this compilation is perfect for quick sessions or marathon play. Test your reflexes and puzzle-solving skills with two of Nintendo’s best puzzle games—now playable online!
